title: Chemistry Vocabulary Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of chemistry terms, from elements and reactions to laboratory equipment and chemical processes.

questions.question: What is a 'catalyst' in chemistry?
options: A substance that speeds up a reaction without being consumed

questions.question: What does 'exothermic' mean when describing a chemical reaction?
What is an 'isotope'?
options: An atom with a different number of neutrons than usual

questions.question: In chemistry, what is a 'solution'?
options: A homogeneous mixture of two or more substances

questions.question: What does 'pH' measure?
options: The acidity or alkalinity of a solution
The boiling point of a compound

questions.question: What is a 'covalent bond'?
options: A bond formed by sharing electrons between atoms
A bond formed by the transfer of electrons

questions.question: What is 'titration'?
options: A technique to determine concentration by adding a reagent until a reaction is complete
Measuring the weight of a compound
Heating a substance until it melts

questions.question: What is a 'precipitate'?
options: An insoluble solid that forms in a solution during a reaction
A gas released during a reaction

questions.question: What is 'valence' in chemistry?
options: The combining capacity of an atom, related to electrons in the outer shell
The speed of a chemical reaction

questions.question: What does 'endothermic' mean?
options: Absorbs heat from the surroundings during a reaction

questions.question: What is a 'mole' in chemistry?
options: A unit representing approximately 6.022 x 10^23 particles

questions.question: What is 'sublimation'?
options: A solid turning directly into gas without becoming liquid first
A chemical reaction that produces heat

questions.question: What is an 'alloy'?
options: A mixture of two or more metals or a metal with another element

questions.question: What does 'distillation' involve?
options: Heating a mixture and collecting the vapor to separate substances by boiling point
Adding a catalyst to speed up a reaction
Freezing a mixture to separate components
